bibl.title: Letter from Felipe Ponce Carbonell to Philip Showalter Hench, November 10, 1952

div1.p: Carbonell responds to Hench's letter expressing apprehension that the Cuban government will name the Camp Lazear monument after Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Felipe Ponce Carbonell to Philip Showalter Hench, November 10, 1952
div1.opener:
Nov. 10, 1952
Dr Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester. Minn.
Dear Dr Hench:
div1.p:
Yesterday - Sunday morning - I received
your letter and I am writing to you
these few lines to make you know
that I understand very well what
you mean and also, the delicate
position in which you are placed.

I always thought that this
oportunity was a good one to
make a Cuban-American Movement
to the doctors of both countries
that helped to conquer the Yellow
fever disease: and I think that
you had the same idea. I can
hardly believe, that an oportunity
like this can be missed.

I hope to have something
to tell you in two or three days.
